intro: Leptorkis grossa, commonly known as the broad-leaved leptorkis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves that are often divided into broad, flat segments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
